title: Joseph Parker reacts to Derek Chisora's win over David Price and calls him out
text:
The New Zealander pulled out of their bout due to a spider bite (Picture: Getty)

Joseph Parker is convinced he would not have suffered the same fate as David Price had he been fit to face Derek Chisora and is eager to finally take on the British heavyweight.

Del Boy had been scheduled to fight Parker at the O2 last weekend but the New Zealander pulled out with a spider bite and late replacement Price gave little resistance as he was stopped inside four rounds.

After the fight, Chisora said he would be happy to take on Parker ‘ASAP’, mocking his illness, though manager David Haye instead called for a bout with WBO mandatory Oleksandr Usyk.

Price had no answer for Chisora’s onslaught of huge punches (Picture: Getty)

Parker watched Saturday night’s fight and shared his frustration at having had to pull out, believing he has all the tools to stop Chisora despite an impressive showing against Price.

Asked if he tuned in to the fight, Parker told Boxing Social: ‘Yeah we watched it. Kev [trainer Kevin Barry] and I were watching very closely and it was a good win for him.

‘He put on a performance where he said he was going to put on pressure, that’s all he does. Puts on pressure and throws big bombs, and he’s fit to do it. So he looked pretty good.

‘That’s his style of fighting, that’s what he’s used to, putting on the pressure, throwing big punches, and he got David Price out of there.

‘For me, if I was in the ring – and I wanted to be in the ring, I was watching with frustration thinking, “Damn I wish I was there” – if it was me I know I would have out-boxed him. And I know I would have caught him coming in, and I know I can put him out.’

Chisora called out Parker in the ring but Haye prefers a fight with Usyk (Picture: Getty)

There have been suggestions that Chisora wants to fight Parker on the Joshua-Ruiz II undercard in Saudi Arabia in December and the Kiwi is up for the challenge, while he disregarded Haye’s remarks about Usyk.

Parker added: ‘I guess they’re looking at all options, but personally I think he should fight me. It’s a fight that we did make, obviously it’s out of control what happened. Things happen in boxing, but we’re ready when they’re ready.’
